abstract: National Basketball Assn and players union meet to try to resolve the lockout before regular-season games are lost, but part once again without an agreement; neither commissioner David Stern nor union president Derek Fisher comment on talks, and it remains unclear whether Stern still plans to cancel games.
snippet: With the first two weeks of the regular season expected to be canceled Monday, the N.B.A. and the players union made another attempt to resolve the lockout.
lead_paragraph: With the first two weeks of the regular season expected to be canceled Monday, the N.B.A. and the players union made another attempt to resolve the lockout.

headline.main: Key Negotiators Make Final Effort to Save Games
headline.print_headline: Key Negotiators Make Final Effort to Save Games
headline.seo: Key N.B.A. Negotiators Make Final Effort to Save Games
